TEXT: The applicants , whose names appear in the appendix , are NORP nationals , and they all live in PERSON . They are represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
Until DATE the applicants lived in GPE in the district of GPE , in GPE , where they owned houses , livestock and land .
In DATE their village was forcibly evacuated and destroyed by security forces . The applicants and their families moved to ORG where they are currently living .

On DATE one of the applicants , PERSON lodged a petition with the LOC Governor ’s office in GPE complaining about the burning of his house and belongings on TIME CARDINAL DATE , requesting the assessment of and compensation for this damage .

On DATE ORG issued a decision of non - jurisdiction in accordance with the PERSON on the Prosecution of Civil Servants ( Memurin Muhakemati Kanunu ) and decided to send the case file to the executive committee of ORG .

In his petition dated DATE , the applicant PERSON complained to the NORP Governor and to ORG that , although he lived in a building constructed for earthquake victims , he had been unable to receive government aid .

On DATE , in reply to the petition of DATE , the NORP Governor of GPE stated that the villages in the area had not been burned by members of the security forces as alleged by the villagers , but by terrorists wearing military uniform .
In DATE the applicant PERSON filed a final complaint with ORG and ORG offices in GPE .
On DATE they received the following letter from the GPE District Governor , ORG :
“ It is established that your village was burned down by terrorists . Therefore , there is no basis to start an investigation against state officers .
Furthermore , I would like to add that the petition which you have filed with us will be considered under the ‘ Return to the Village and Rehabilitation Project’ . ”
The case file does not contain any document submitted by the second applicant , PERSON .
Until DATE the applicants all lived in GPE , in the district of GPE , in GPE , where they owned houses , livestock and land .
In DATE their village was forcibly evacuated and destroyed by security forces . The applicants and their families moved to ORG where they are currently living .
On DATE CARDINAL of the applicants , Mr PERSON , who is the village mayor ( muhtar ) , filed a petition with the GPE office in GPE , on behalf of the villagers , complaining about the eviction .
On DATE he requested a loan from ORG in GPE to allow the villagers to cultivate their land .

On DATE some mayors , including PERSON , lodged a petition with ORG , where they complained of a reimbursement order asking the villagers to pay back government aid previously granted as compensation for their losses in the DATE earthquake . They demanded the annulment of the reimbursement order on the ground that the villagers had lost all their property during the destruction of their villages .

On DATE the mayors petitioned the Governor ’s office in GPE , ORG , the Governor ’s office in the state of emergency region , ORG Presidency , the Prime Minister ’s office and the Presidency of the ORG . They requested compensation for their losses .

On DATE Mr PERSON lodged further petitions with various government offices , namely the Governor ’s office in GPE , the Presidency of the ORG , the Prime Minister ’s office and the office of the President of the Republic , requesting permission on behalf of the villagers to return to their villages .
In DATE the applicants filed a final complaint with ORG offices in GPE .
On DATE they received the following letter from the GPE District Governor , ORG :
“ It is established that your village was burned down by terrorists . Therefore , there is no basis to start an investigation against state officers .
Furthermore , I would like to add that the petition which you have filed with us will be considered under the ‘ Return to the Village and Rehabilitation Project’ . ”
Until DATE the applicants lived in the above villages , in the district of GPE , in GPE , where they owned houses , livestock and land .
In DATE the villages were forcibly evacuated and destroyed by security forces . The applicants and their families moved to ORG where they are currently living .
On DATE the mayors of the above mentioned villages filed a petition with ORG in the province , demanding government aid .

On DATE they also petitioned ORG , demanding the annulment of a reimbursement order concerning aid previously granted as compensation following the earthquake of DATE , on the ground that they had lost all their property during the destruction of their villages .

On DATE they petitioned various authorities , namely the Governor ’s office in GPE , ORG , the Governor ’s office in the state of emergency region , ORG Presidency , the Prime Minister ’s office and the Presidency of the ORG . They requested compensation for their losses .

On DATE the village mayors lodged further petitions with various government offices , namely the Governor ’s office in GPE , the Presidency of the ORG , the Prime Minister ’s office and the office of the President of the Republic , requesting permission for villagers to return to their villages .

On DATE the mayor of ORG village issued a press release along with some other villagers and representatives of some associations , denouncing the incidents that had taken place in the villages in their area .
In DATE the applicants filed a final complaint with the Governor ’s and Public Prosecutor ’s offices in GPE .
On DATE they received the following letter from the GPE District Governor , ORG :
“ It is established that your village was burned down by terrorists . Therefore , there is no basis to start an investigation against state officers .
Furthermore , I would like to add that the petition which you have filed with us will be considered under the ‘ Return to the Village and Rehabilitation Project’ . ”
Until DATE the applicants lived in the above villages in the district of GPE , in GPE , where they owned houses , livestock and land .
In DATE the villages were forcibly evacuated and destroyed by security forces . The applicants and their families moved to ORG where they are currently living .

On DATE the mayors of the above villages lodged a petition with ORG , demanding the annulment of a reimbursement order concerning aid previously granted as compensation following the earthquake of DATE , on the ground that they had lost all their property during the destruction of their villages .
In CARDINAL DATE the mayors , villagers and some associations issued a press release , denouncing the burning of their villages .

On DATE the mayor of the NORP village lodged further petitions with various government offices , namely the Governor ’s office in GPE , the Presidency of the ORG , the Prime Minister ’s office and the office of the President of the Republic , requesting permission for the villagers to return to their villages .
In DATE the applicants filed a final complaint with the Governor ’s and Public Prosecutor ’s office in GPE .
On DATE they received the following letter from the GPE District Governor , ORG :
“ It is established that your village was burned down by terrorists . Therefore , there is no basis to start an investigation against state officers .
Furthermore , I would like to add that the petition which you have filed with us will be considered under the ‘ Return to the Village and Rehabilitation Project’ . ”
Until DATE the applicant lived in GPE in the district of GPE , in GPE , where he owned a house , livestock and land .
In DATE his village was forcibly evacuated and destroyed by security forces . The applicant and his family moved to ORG where they are currently living .
On DATE the applicant petitioned the ORG office complaining about the forced eviction by security forces and asked for compensation .

On DATE the mayor of the applicant ’s village sent letters to the Governor ’s office in GPE , to ORG , to the Governor ’s office in the state of emergency region and to the Prime Minister ’s office complaining about the impugned incident .
On DATE the applicant sent another letter to the District Governor ’s office asking for help .
On DATE and DATE the applicant sent petitions to the GPE office and to ORG , respectively .
In his third letter dated DATE addressed to the District Governor , the applicant complained about the authorities’ refusal to grant him aid .
The applicant filed CARDINAL more petitions with the GPE office , CARDINAL dated DATE and the other undated .

In his petition of DATE , the applicant requested permission to return to his village invoking his rights under LAW No . CARDINAL to the LAW . The District Governor , in a reply dated CARDINAL DATE , informed the applicant that the authorities were working on a project that would enable the villagers to return to their homes .

On DATE the applicant received another letter from the District Governor , drawing attention to the lack of evidence which would allow the authorities to initiate an investigation into the allegation that his house in the LOC village had been burned down by security forces .
Until DATE the applicants lived in GPE , in the district of GPE , in GPE , where they owned houses , livestock and land .
In DATE the village was forcibly evacuated and destroyed by security forces . The applicants and their families moved to ORG where they are currently living .
Following their eviction , the applicants , a father and his son , complained to the District Governor and to ORG in GPE .
The public prosecutor verbally rejected the ORG allegations that the security officers had evacuated their village however he continued with taking their statements .

In DATE the applicants petitioned various administrative authorities , namely the Governor ’s office in GPE , ORG , the Governor ’s office in the state of emergency region and the Prime Minister ’s office , complaining about the evacuation of their village and the refusal of the authorities to allow them to return to their homes . The applicants did not receive any reply from these authorities .
In DATE the applicants filed a petition with the District Governor in GPE . They requested permission to return to their village and compensation for their losses .

On DATE the applicants received a letter from the District Governor in reply to their petition . The District Governor informed the applicants that their request would be considered within the context of the “ Return to Villages and Rehabilitation Project ” .
The investigation carried out by the authorities indicated that the applicants had left their villages on their own will . The security forces had not forced the applicants to leave their village .

The official records indicated that there was no obstacle preventing villagers from returning to their homes and possessions in their villages . Persons who had left their villages as a result of terrorism had already started returning and regaining their activities in their villages .

On DATE the Law on Compensation for Losses resulting from Terrorism and the Fight against Terrorism was passed by ORG and entered into force on DATE ( “ Compensation Law ” ) . That PERSON provided for a sufficient remedy capable of redressing the LAW grievances of persons who were denied access to their possessions in their villages .

In that connection Damage Assessment and Compensation Commissions were set up in QUANTITY provinces . Persons who had suffered damage as a result of terrorism or of measures taken by the authorities to combat terrorism could lodge an application with the relevant compensation commission claiming compensation .

The number of persons applying to these commissions had already attained CARDINAL . CARDINAL persons , whose applications were pending before the ORG , had also applied to the compensation commissions . Many villagers had already been awarded compensation for the damage they had sustained .

A description of the relevant domestic law can be found in the ORG ’s decision of PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) and in its judgment of ORG and Others v. GPE ( nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL - CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-VI ) .
